result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph J Meng was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DE will be allowed Huber privilege

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

DE will complete an AODA Assessment and any follow up recommended, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alochol or drugs without a valid prescription, no entry into bars, taverns or liquor stores.

Defendant Joseph J Meng in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  Defendant Joseph J Meng in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF90, 14CF100, 14CF115, 15CF86.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights-15CF86.  

14CF74-Revoke DAGP, one year jail.  Credit for 184 days,  civil JU for unpaid court costs.

14CF90-time served.  (184 days)  JU for unpaid CC, concurrent. 

14CF100-time served.  (184 days)  JU for unpaid CC, concurrent.

Bond will be revoked.  DE would like a PSI prepared.  Court will order PSI preparation.  Set for sentencing 2-2-16 @ 1:00PM.  

14CF115-Revoke DAGP, enter plea of NG

15CF86-Ct 1, dismiss repeater,  Ct 3-DE will enter a plea of G to both counts.  Ct's 2,4,5 will be DRI.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 12-01-2015 01:00 pm
Filed in 14CF90
Dated 10-30-15 from Nussberger Law Office to LG
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 12-03-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Joseph J Meng in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF90, 14CF100, 15CF115, 15CF53, 15CT21, along with uncharges case.  Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  Court satisfied will accept waiver.  DE will enter plea's to the following cases.  
14CF74-Ct 1, NC plea, court will note but hold in abeyance for a two year period.  Must complete all conditions laid out in the DAGP. Bond continues
14CF90-Ct 2, NC plea, court will accept and find the DE guilty.
14CF100-Ct 1, NC plea, Court will accept and find the DE guilty.  
14CF115-Ct 1, NC plea, court will note but hold in abeyance for a two year period.  Must complete all conditions laid out in the DAGP. Bond continues

15CT21, 15CF53, uncharged case and additional counts in above case will be DRI.  
Mr Meng addresses the court.  The court will accept the recommendations of the parties.  Will withhold sentence, 2 years probation, will serve 15 days jail on each count, consecutive, pay CC in both cases.  Will maintain sobriety, no bars, taverns or liquor stores,  jail will be served at the discretion of the DOC officer.  Court costs will be taken from the bond posted.  Any additional will be returned to poster.  DE's truck will be released to his father.  Will report to probation today.
filed in 14CF74

Defendant Joseph J Meng in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF90, 14CF100, 14CF115.  Waive prelim hearing in 14CF100.  Court instructs on waiver of prelim.  Court will accept waiver. Information filed this day in court.  Waive reading of the information, enter a plea of NG.  Atty wishes to address the issue of bond requirement for daily PBT's.  State opposes removing the daily PBT's.  If DE provides proof to the court  four weeks of AA class attendance the court will lift the daily PBT's.  14CF115-waive reading of the CC.  Waive time limits for prelim hearing.  Court instructs on waiver of time limits.  Court will accept waiver.  Set for 2-02-15 @ 1:00 PM for prelim hearing.
Preliminary hearing on January 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
filed by State Public Defender with attached cover LETC

Defendant Joseph J Meng in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Andrea Amidon Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF90.  14CF74-14CF90-  Waive formal reading of Criminal Complaints.  $2500.00 sign bond, no possession or consumption of alcohol, do not enter premises where alcohol is the primary business, any bars, taverns or liquor stores, will do daily PBT's at the direction of the SD.  Atty objects to daily PBT's.  The court will keep the daily PBT requirement.  Court instructs on waiver of prelim hearing.  Court will accept waiver, will bind over.  State will file information within 30 days.  Set for arraignment 11-04-14 @ 3:30PM. Bonds concurrent.
